text:
If you have two sources of income or receive disability benefits (both, in my case)  - then you are out of luck. For context, following a traumatic brain injury, I began receiving short-term disability benefits in addition to my job income. I was only medically cleared to work reduced hours and slowly work back up to 40 hrs/week, so the supplemental income was needed. 

To preface, MoneyLion was initially my preferred app among similar cash advance apps that I tried. I signed up for a Roar Money account, ordered a debit card, and even took out a Credit Builder loan. Unfortunately, I am now stuck paying off a loan and paying a monthly membership fee for an app that I can’t use anymore.

Despite what the website states regarding "qualifying income deposits," MoneyLion does not actually recognize payroll-related/disability benefits as regular sources of income. #1) The app doesn’t recognize it as income, and users cannot change it. #2) When I reached out about this issue in the app, multiple customer service reps eventually informed me that disability benefits are not recognized as income. 

I still didn’t believe it, so I reached out again the following day. I asked them to confirm that disability benefits are not recognized as income. After a long wait, I was told that the issues were actually due to the fact that MoneyLion doesn’t support two sources of income - even if they both meet the “qualifying income requirements” outlined on the website, and even if they both contribute equally to monthly income. It confuses their algorithm - they cannot override it. My overall experience with customer service is a different story for a different day. 

PLEASE, if you fall into one of the categories mentioned above, save yourself some time and energy. Use a different app that better supports you.
title: Proceed With Caution

text: If you’re in a bind MoneyLion is a life saver! I enjoy using the app, it recommends loans, credit building, investing and help with savings. My only con would be with instacash withdrawls and fees. When I first started using the app I was able to request instacash advances over $100 all in one order. Now you have to make multiple requests and the fees can become burdensome! While MoneyLion is good if you’re short on cash and need a few extra dollars until payday, the fees can add up with every withdrawal you make leading to an even bigger bind.
title: If you’re in a bind MoneyLion is a life…

text:
I have been a long time customer of MoneyLion and had to move my direct deposit and accounts to another bank because I became so annoyed with their constant attempts to get ‘tips’ from their cash advance feature.
I reached out to customer service and and asked why ask for tips and who actually gets the tips and no answer was ever given.
When a cash advance is requested, can be anywhere from $5 to $100 they will slip in a tip request, not once or twice, but FOUR times! If you’re not careful they will scam you out of several dollars to get a cash advance that already has fees attached.

I could no longer do business with this sort of sneaky practice. Be aware if you decide to use their payday advance!
title: Payday Advance tip scam

reply.message: We appreciate you taking the time to share your review and feedback, Michael. If you would like to speak with someone about your experience, we ask that you complete and submit our contact form by copy and pasting this link; https://mlion.info/customerhelp, into an open browser window. Once received, a member of our team with reach out to you directly. Please note that the Instacash service is free of charge; however, you do have the option to pay a Turbo fee to receive the requested funds within minutes and/or leave a tip if you are enjoying the service.
